trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when you attempt to do work on a transaction that cannot accept new work.
TransactionException is a recoverable error, and all the exceptions thrown by the <xref:System.Transactions> infrastructure derive from this exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionException"></xref> class with the specified message.
A <xref:System.String> that contains a message that explains why the exception occurred.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionException"></xref> class with the specified serialization and streaming context information.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that describes a failed serialization.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that describes a failed serialization context.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionException"></xref> class with the specified message and inner exception.
A <xref:System.String> that contains a message that explains why the exception occurred.
Gets the exception instance that causes the current exception.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*> property.
